sentence.Network_cn: 用水把涂料稀释到牛奶般的稠度。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting permanence of form): from late Latin consistentia, from consistent- 'standing firm' (see consistent)

entry.def: Consistency is the quality or condition of being consistent.

example.ex: He scores goals with remarkable consistency...
There's always a lack of consistency in matters of foreign policy.
example.tran: 外交政策总是缺乏连贯性。

entry.def: The consistency of a substance is how thick or smooth it is.

example.ex: Dilute the paint with water until it is the consistency of milk...
example.tran: 用水把涂料稀释到牛奶般的稠度。

example.ex: I added a little milk to mix the dough to the right consistency.
example.tran: 我加了一点儿牛奶，好让面团稠度适中。

means.word_mean: 1. the property of holding together and retaining its shape;

sentences.sentence: "when the dough has enough consistency it is ready to bake"

means.word_mean: 2. a harmonious uniformity or agreement among things or parts
3. logical coherence and accordance with the facts;

sentences.sentence: "a rambling argument that lacked any consistency"

means.word_mean: 4. (logic) an attribute of a logical system that is so constituted that none of the propositions deducible from the axioms contradict one another

auth_sentence.content: The batter should be the consistency of double cream.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The batter should be the consistency of double cream.

auth_sentence.res_content: Reduce all the way down to a sticky consistency.

sentences.en: The amendment will remove the inconsistency between the two laws.
sentences.cn: 修正案将会消除这两条法律之间的不一致之处。

means.word_mean: 坚实度, 浓度, 黏稠度

sentences.en: Knead the dough to the right consistency.
sentences.cn: 把面团揉到适合的黏稠度。

sentences.en: Add milk to produce a soft dropping consistency.
sentences.cn: 加牛奶至一种柔滑可滴的黏稠度。
